channel.title: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele
channel.description: hello, can anyone tell me how to make a command so when i enter bounty hunter crater i do::locate i tele to my target. please would be so awesome if you help me and thanks :) btw skype is : areyou.mad or tell me here :)

item.title: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele
item.dc:creator: @General_Z General Z
item.description:
@General_Z wrote:

no point … please someone add me skype: areyou.mad i need help

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele

item.title: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:536007”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=654813.msg4385602#msg4385602 date=1385388373]
I rest my case…
[/quote]
Your case? Dude, he copy and pasted my code when I said that it’d guarantee errors. That has NOTHING to do with the fact that he could/could not know how to create a client object.

OP, I wrote all that code in the reply box, and I don’t know your variables. You’re going to have to change some things out for it to work properly.
c.inBounty() - This needs to be your check if the player using the command is actually in bounty hunter or not. If you don’t have a variable like this, then in Player.java you need to add something like:

public boolean inBounty() { if(c.getX() => 0 && c.getX() =< 100 && c.getY() => 0 && c.getY() =< 100){ return true; }else { return false; } return false; }

Now you’d obviously have to change the coords for that to work, but that’s the general idea.

As for making a client object:
Client target = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[index];

There’s your basic structure. However, you’re going to want to change [index] to the variable that is saved in Bounty Hunter for your target players player ID (That’s what index is in this case).

Lastly, for not having the variable ‘height’ try changing it to ‘heightLevel’ or check your playersave for the variable that tells you what height you’re on.[/quote]

My case was the fact he clearly didn’t read anything your post about getting errors, and he thought that would compile just fine.

If he fails to make sense of that, how is he going to know what your code means.

But now you’ve provided a little extra help that should aid him.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele

item.title: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ohokay:

I rest my case…

Your case? Dude, he copy and pasted my code when I said that it’d guarantee errors. That has NOTHING to do with the fact that he could/could not know how to create a client object.

OP, I wrote all that code in the reply box, and I don’t know your variables. You’re going to have to change some things out for it to work properly.
c.inBounty() - This needs to be your check if the player using the command is actually in bounty hunter or not. If you don’t have a variable like this, then in Player.java you need to add something like:

public boolean inBounty() { if(c.getX() => 0 && c.getX() =< 100 && c.getY() => 0 && c.getY() =< 100){ return true; }else { return false; } return false; }

Now you’d obviously have to change the coords for that to work, but that’s the general idea.

As for making a client object:
Client target = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[index];

There’s your basic structure. However, you’re going to want to change [index] to the variable that is saved in Bounty Hunter for your target players player ID (That’s what index is in this case).

Lastly, for not having the variable ‘height’ try changing it to ‘heightLevel’ or check your playersave for the variable that tells you what height you’re on.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele

item.title: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

[quote=“General Z, post:6, topic:536007”]i got error :S please help

src\rs2\model\players\packets\Commands.java:143: error: cannot find symbol
if(c.inBounty()){//Making sure the player is in bounty hunter when doing th
is command
^
symbol: method inBounty()
location: variable c of type Client
src\rs2\model\players\packets\Commands.java:144: error: cannot find symbol
Client target = (Client) c.yourBountyHunterNameVariable;//This isn’t g
oing to compile right.
^
symbol: variable yourBountyHunterNameVariable
location: variable c of type Client
src\rs2\model\players\packets\Commands.java:145: error: cannot find symbol
c.startTeleport(target.getX(), target.getY(), target.height);//Assumin
g you have these variables
^
symbol: variable height
location: variable target of type Client
Note: src\rs2\world\map\I.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
3 errors
Press any key to continue . . .
}[/quote]

AT LEAST read the whole post before you try just throwing random code in. :palm:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:536007”] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("locate")){ if(c.inBounty()){//Making sure the player is in bounty hunter when doing this command Client target = (Client) c.yourBountyHunterNameVariable;//This isn't going to compile right. c.startTeleport(target.getX(), target.getY(), target.height);//[size=14pt]Assuming you have these variables[/size] c.sendMessage("You teleport to your target"); }else{ c.sendMessage("You must be in bounty hunter to do this command"); } }

The command is just a mock up and you have to edit parts of it to work properly. Copy+Pasting will guarantee errors.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with PI 317 bounty hunter crater command locate target tele
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:536007”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=654813.msg4385465#msg4385465 date=1385315222]

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("locate")){ if(c.inBounty()){//Making sure the player is in bounty hunter when doing this command Client target = (Client) c.yourBountyHunterNameVariable;//This isn't going to compile right. c.startTeleport(target.getX(), target.getY(), target.height);//Assuming you have these variables c.sendMessage("You teleport to your target"); }else{ c.sendMessage("You must be in bounty hunter to do this command"); } }

The command is just a mock up and you have to edit parts of it to work properly. Copy+Pasting will guarantee errors.

bountyHunterNameVariable?

It needs to get the pid of the target, not any bounty hunter variable

[/quote]
I’m not going to spoonfeed EVERYTHING for the kid, christ man.[/quote]

If you’re gonna help at least provide decent help. It’s not spoon feeding at all.

What if he doesn’t understand the concept of creating a client object, and how it can be used to refer to a specific player. Any variable name isn’t going to help him

Read full topic

The command is just a mock up and you have to edit parts of it to work properly. Copy+Pasting will guarantee errors.
[/quote]

It needs to get the pid of the target, not any bounty hunter variable[/quote]
